basics.name: Ariana Hanshaw
basics.label: Technical Writer
basics.summary: Atlanta-based technical writer with a young, creative flair. Previously in the healthcare technology industry, Ari values an environment where learning is king and her coworkers are just as passionate about it as she is.

work.name: Zelis Healthcare
work.summary: Moving the needle in knowledge analytics, creating a culture of informed decisionmaking. Who says knowledge can't be measured?
highlights: Designed, engineered, launched, and marketed an SSO-enabled enterprise knowledge base
Leads enterprise-level communications on behalf of IT teams
Manages SharePoint presence for enterprise-level IT

work.name: Self-employed
work.summary: Educating others to champion their web presence, finding creative solutions for modern problems.
highlights: Iterates on client briefs to ideate brand identities—logos, wordmarks, various icons and illustrations
Consults on livestreaming projects—bot configuration, audio mixing, color grading

work.name: Flourish Software
work.summary: Provided customers and coworkers with the support they needed to succeed, promoting knowledge and education as a root cause resolution.
highlights: Engineered bespoke Jira automations according to individual customer needs
The go-to support engineer for the company's top-paying client
Researched, wrote, and promoted extensive end-user documentation

work.name: Surterra Holdings, Inc.
work.summary: Documented on-the-ground processes to quantify work flowing through cultivation sites, allowing the team to investigate feature parity in a cost-saving software alternative.
highlights: Interviewed SMEs, using investigative techniques to turn tacit knowledge into explicit knowledge
Wrote release notes for the cultivators' software to improve understanding of new features

projects.name: Zelis: Associate Knowledge Base
projects.summary: As Zelis began sunsetting the long-used ServiceNow© knowledge base, they needed technical expertise, a creative eye, and a deep understanding of knowledge management to make a smooth transition to a static site. Matching the company's existing brand identity and appearance, I crafted a modern, sleek experience for users to browse, search, and even download articles written by our knowledge management team. I am also the knowledge management team.
